result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip G Dament was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip G Dament

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Video produced by defendant (stored bottom shelf in vault)

Defendant Phillip G Dament in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader. Statements by victims family to the Court. Statement by Attorney Johnson. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court regarding the video. Court sentences the defendant to: Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Surcharge but no sample to be provided. Appeal Rights Given.
Letter from Attorney Johnson with video produced by Defendant.

Defendant Phillip G Dament in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader states agreement on record and will move to amend count 1 to Negligent Operation of a Motor Vehilce off Highway. 941.01 a class A. Misdemeanor.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by victims family. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Withhold Sentencing. Court directs the following:  The defendant is to contact either Trooper Rainer or Trooper Tom Parrot and over the course of a year to coordinate the production or creation of a safety training video that uses this incident and others like it in hard copy to be used at the discretion of State Patrol training purposes and through their safety protocal to entities that are operating units such as this. Production cost limited at $5000.00 to be paid by the defendant. To examine the ways of the realities of his business with the hazards that are represented. Court wants to see the video a year from now at the sentencing. Conditions of bond will remain in effect. In the event State Patrol is not willing, DNR is an alternative to making this project possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
from the Court - Restitution concerns will be addressed at the plea/sentencing hearing
from DA Blader with attached correspondence from Atty Johson - Re: Restitution
from DA's Office advising that a plea/sentencing hearing can be scheduled

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Johnson:  Negotiations continue and suggests one more STC.  DA agrees.  STC adjourned for approx 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:35 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnson requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
from Atty Johnson Re: Possible Rescheduling of IA on 6/16/2015
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner in which Defendant is operating.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:27 PM:  Defendant Phillip G Dament in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  Counsel to conduct an informal PTC prior to return for STC.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court advises counsel of a potential judicial conflict.  Atty Johnson does not see any potential conflict.  DA argues as to bond request.  No objection by Atty Johnson as to bond request.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions
